intro: Rogiera intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate rogeria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Rogiera intermedia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
